Amended Memorandum and Order
SMITH, District Judge.
Akhil Gupta ("Gupta" or "Plaintiff") brought suit against his former employer, Customerlinx Corporation ("Customerlinx" or "Defendant"), seeking money damages for fraud and breach of contract. After a four-day trial, the jury returned a verdict in favor of Gupta for fraud in the amount of $125,000 and for breach of contract in the amount of $124,000. Before this Court are Defendant's Renewed Motion for Judgment as a Matter of Law, or in the alternative, Motion for New Trial,[1] and Plaintiff's Motion to Alter, Amend and/or Correct Judgment to Add Prejudgment Interest. After careful review, this Court *160 DENIES Defendant's Motion and GRANTS Plaintiff's Motion.
I. Background
Customerlinx offers customer support services to businesses through its operation of call centers.
